item.title: Briton Ryan becomes two-weight world champion
item.description: Briton Sandy Ryan becomes a two-weight world champion with a hard-fought points win over light-welterweight Karla Ramos Zamora in Nottingham.

item.title: Benn joining Zuffa 'dagger in the heart' for Hearn
item.description: Eddie Hearn says he is "devastated" after Conor Benn made the "very painful" decision to leave Matchroom Boxing organisation to join Dana White's Zuffa Boxing promotional company.

item.title: Mayweather, 48, out of retirement for fourth time
item.description: Former world champion Floyd Mayweather will come out of retirement for a fourth time following his upcoming exhibition bout with Mike Tyson, to take part in his first professional fight for nearly 10 years.

item.title: The Uber-driving English champion & his 30-year fight for a passport
item.description: English light-middleweight champion Bilal Fawaz challenges for the British title belt on Saturday, but is still fighting for a British passport.

item.title: How safe is bare-knuckle boxing as it fights for mainstream appeal?
item.description: A new BBC documentary looks at the rise of bare-knuckle boxing as fighter Liam 'Rocky' Rees tells BBC Sport why he loves the adrenaline.

item.title: No 'easy' rematch with Warrington, says Wood
item.description: Leigh Wood says he "does not want an easy night" against Josh Warrington when the former featherweight world champions renew their rivalry in Nottingham on Saturday.

item.title: Olympic trials to £6m deal - Shields' full-circle moment
item.description: Undisputed heavyweight champion Claressa Shields tells BBC Sport how she stays motivated as she prepares to face Franchon Crews-Dezurn.

item.title: Fury to have no coach or nutritionist for comeback
item.description: Tyson Fury makes his return on 11 April and believes his inactivity could play a big role in his comeback.

item.title: Boxing rivalry is one thing, humanity is another - Fury
item.description: Former world heavyweight champion Tyson Fury says Anthony Joshua is on "his own journey" after being involved in a car crash in which two of his close friends died.

item.title: Fury says latest comeback is 'to make boxing great again'
item.description: Former world heavyweight champion Tyson Fury says his latest comeback is in order "to make boxing great again".

item.title: 'Rebuild of myself' - Wilder opens up on mental health
item.description: Former world heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder opens up about his mental health struggles, and says he's now "at peace" before his fight against Derek Chisora on 4 April at London's O2 Arena.

item.title: 'I bring a circus' - ringmaster Fury in 'prime' for Makhmudov fight
item.description: Showman Tyson Fury says he is "coming back to make boxing great again" as he prepares to fight Russia's Arslanbek Makhmudov in April.

item.title: Will British boxing finally get a fighters' union?
item.description: British boxers have never had a successful trade union - but that could be about to change.

item.title: 'Can't live in the past' - Warren on boxing's future after 45 years as promoter
item.description: After celebrating 45 years as a boxing promoter this year and a period of rapid change, Frank Warren expects more to come in the next decades.

item.title: 'Boxing can be messed up' - how to build a prospect
item.description: Hassan Ishaq is beginning his boxing career with just two fights under his belt. BBC Sport speaks to his team the "delicate" task of building a prospect.

item.title: 'Spooky premonitions' drive unfancied Kelly to top of boxing mountain
item.description: Josh Kelly says he was getting "spooky" premonitions during fight week prior to beating Bakhram Murtazaliev for the IBF light-middleweight title.

item.title: How an inspiring home video launched a main event fighter
item.description: How Francesca Hennessy - who headlines on BBC Two on Saturday - went from weight and dyslexia struggles to viral fame and in sight of a world-title shot.

item.title: Pierce Brosnan, Prince Naz and the embrace that never happened
item.description: When Prince Naseem Hamed met actor Pierce Brosnan in the lead-up to a new film, it brought back thoughts of a reconciliation with trainer Brendan Ingle that never happened.

item.title: 'You're under arrest' - how Ngamba made history against all odds
item.description: Cindy Ngamba shares her incredible story from refugee to Olympic medallist.

item.title: 'I wouldn't wish what I went through on my worst enemy'
item.description: Undisputed middleweight boxing world champion Claressa Shields opens up about her harrowing journey to the top of her sport.

item.title: From rock bottom to three world titles at 37
item.description: Natasha Jonas tells her story, including what it took to come back and win three world titles at 37.

item.title: Being a Eubank, living up to dad and dealing with grief
item.description: Born To Brawl: Chris Eubank Jr tells his story of grief and living up to his dad

item.title: Are Prince Naseem Hamed's sons coming for his throne?
item.description: Get to know the Hameds' journey ahead of Aadam Hamed's debut on the Oleksandr Usyk v Daniel Dubois undercard.

item.title: Tyson rates him: Is traveller Dennis McCann boxing's next superstar?
item.description: Tyson Fury tips traveller boxer Dennis ‘The Menace’ McCann as future world champion

item.title: Church told me I was possessed by demons aged 12
item.description: Conor Benn tells BBC Sport about growing up in an "extreme" Christian school, being told he was "demon-possessed" and how he had to rebuild a relationship with his father Nigel.

item.title: I'm going to show the world - Hennessy
item.description: Francesca Hennessy talks to BBC Sport about her inspirations and goals before her fight against Ellie Boutell.

item.title: 'I gave everything to boxing and still have nothing'
item.description: Heather Hardy tells BBC Sport how she is adapting to life outside of boxing after the former world champion was left with a life-threatening injury.
